description: Scanva Output UX Improvements - File-by-file violation display with visual indicators and proper exit codes

userStories.title: Remove old summary-first output format
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the old summary output removed so we can replace it with the new file-focused format.
acceptanceCriteria: Remove 'Total violations' summary line from output
Remove 'ERROR: N' and 'WARNING: N' summary sections
Remove 'Flagged files' list from output
Reporter still collects violation data (no data structure changes)
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Display violations per file with ASCII indicators
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to see each violation mapped to its file with visual indicators so I know exactly what to fix.
acceptanceCriteria: Output shows each flagged file as section header (file path on its own line)
Each violation under file shows: ● (U+25CF) for ERROR, ▲ (U+25B2) for WARNING
Violation format: '{indicator} {Error|Warning} : {rule_pattern_or_description}'
Violations grouped by file path
Blank line between file sections
ASCII symbols render in VS Code, PhpStorm, and standard terminals
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add summary footer with violation counts
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a quick count of total errors and warnings at the bottom.
acceptanceCriteria: Footer shows: '{error_count} Error(s), {warning_count} Warning(s)' after all file sections
Footer only appears if violations exist (violations > 0)
Blank line before footer for visual separation
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Fix exit code on validation errors
userStories.description: As a CI/CD system, I need a non-zero exit code when violations exist so the build fails properly.
acceptanceCriteria: Exit code = 1 when any ERROR violations exist
Exit code = 0 when no violations found
Exit code = 0 when only WARNING violations exist (no errors)
Verify with test: 'node ./bin/run.js --commit <hash-with-errors> && echo Pass || echo Fail' outputs 'Fail'
Typecheck passes
